element.name: SysUtils
element.short: Various calls.

element.name: AnsiResemblesText
element.short: Check whether 2 strings resemble each other.
element.descr:
AnsiResemblesText
will check whether is set. If it is not set, False is returned. If it is set, AText and AOtherText are passed to it and it's result is returned.

element.name: AnsiResemblesText.Result
element.short:
True
if the words match, False if not

element.name: AnsiResemblesText.AText
element.short: First text to compare

element.name: AnsiResemblesText.AOther
element.short: Second text to compare

element.name: AnsiContainsText
element.short: Check whether a string contains a certain substring, ignoring case.
element.descr:
AnsiContainsString
checks whether AText contains ASubText, and returns True if this is the case, or returns False otherwise. The search is performed case-insensitive.

element.name: AnsiContainsText.Result
element.short:
True
if the substring was found, False otherwise.

element.name: AnsiContainsText.AText
element.short: The string to be searched

element.name: AnsiContainsText.ASubText
element.short: The substring to search for

element.name: AnsiStartsText
element.short: Check whether a string starts with a given substring, ignoring case
element.descr:
AnsiEndsText
checks AText to see whether it starts with ASubText , and returns True if it does, False if not. The check is performed case-insensitive. Basically, it checks whether the position of ASubText equals 1.

element.name: AnsiStartsText.Result
element.short:
True
if the given string starts with the substring, False if not.

element.name: AnsiStartsText.ASubText
element.short: Substring to check for

element.name: AnsiStartsText.AText
element.short: String to check in

element.name: AnsiEndsText
element.short: Check whether a string ends with a certain substring, ignoring case.
element.descr:
AnsiEndsStr
checks AText
to see whether it ends with ASubText
, and returns True
if it does, False
if not. The check is performed case-insensitive. Basically, it checks whether the position of ASubText
equals the length of AText
minus the length of ASubText
plus one.

element.name: AnsiEndsText.Result
element.short:
True
if the string ends on the substring, False otherwise.

element.name: AnsiEndsText.ASubText
element.short: Substring to check for.

element.name: AnsiEndsText.AText
element.short: Text to check the end of

element.name: AnsiReplaceText
element.short: Search and replace all occurrences of a string, case sensitive.
element.descr:
AnsiReplaceString
searches AText for all occurrences of the string AFromText and replaces them with AToText
, and returns the resulting string. The search is performed ignoring case.

element.name: AnsiReplaceText.Result
element.short: Result of the search and replace operation.

element.name: AnsiReplaceText.AText
element.short: String in which to search and replace.

element.name: AnsiReplaceText.AFromText
element.short: String to search for

element.name: AnsiReplaceText.AToText
element.short: String to replace with

element.name: AnsiMatchText
element.short: Check whether a string occurs in an array of strings, disregarding case.

descr.p:
AnsiIndexStr
matches AText against each string in AValues. If a match is found, it returns True, otherwise False is returned. The strings are matched ignoring case.
This function simply calls ad checks whether it returns -1 or not.

element.name: AnsiMatchText.Result
element.short:
True
if the value appears in the array, False if not.

element.name: AnsiMatchText.AText
element.short: String to check for

element.name: AnsiMatchText.AValues
element.short: Array of string values to search in

element.name: AnsiIndexText
element.short: Searches, case insensitive, for a string in an array of strings.
element.descr:
AnsiIndexStr
matches AText
against each string in AValues
. If a match is found, the corresponding index (zero-based) in the AValues
array is returned. If no match is found, -1 is returned.
The strings are matched ignoring case.

element.name: AnsiIndexText.Result
element.short: Index of the matching element in the array, otherwise -1.

element.name: AnsiIndexText.AText
element.short: String to search for

element.name: AnsiIndexText.AValues
element.short: Array of strings to search in.

element.name: AnsiContainsStr
element.short: Checks whether a string contains a given substring
element.descr:
AnsiContainsString
checks whether AText contains ASubText, and returns True if this is the case, or returns False otherwise. The search is performed case-sensitive.

element.name: AnsiContainsStr.Result
element.short:
True
if the string contains the given substring, False otherwise

element.name: AnsiContainsStr.AText
element.short: String to search in

element.name: AnsiContainsStr.ASubText
element.short: The substring to be searched for

element.name: AnsiStartsStr
element.short: Check whether a string starts with a given substring, observing case
element.descr:
AnsiEndsStr
checks AText to see whether it starts with ASubText , and returns True if it does, False if not. The check is performed case-sensitive. Basically, it checks whether the position of ASubText equals 1.

element.name: AnsiStartsStr.Result
element.short:
True
if the given string starts with the substring, False if not.

element.name: AnsiStartsStr.ASubText
element.short: Substring to check for

element.name: AnsiStartsStr.AText
element.short: String to check in

element.name: AnsiEndsStr
element.short: Check whether a string ends with a certain substring
element.descr:
AnsiEndsStr
checks AText to see whether it ends with ASubText, and returns True if it does, False if not. The check is performed case-sensitive. Basically, it checks whether the position of ASubText equals the length of AText minus the length of ASubText plus one.

element.name: AnsiEndsStr.Result
element.short:
True
if the string ends on the substring, False otherwise.

element.name: AnsiEndsStr.ASubText
element.short: Substring to check for.

element.name: AnsiEndsStr.AText
element.short: Text to check the end of

element.name: AnsiReplaceStr
element.short: Search and replace all occurrences of a string, case sensitive.
element.descr:
AnsiReplaceString
searches AText for all occurrences of the string AFromText and replaces them with AToText, and returns the resulting string. The search is performed observing case.

element.name: AnsiReplaceStr.Result
element.short: Result of the search and replace operation

element.name: AnsiReplaceStr.AText
element.short: String in which to search and replace.

element.name: AnsiReplaceStr.AFromText
element.short: String to search for

element.name: AnsiReplaceStr.AToText
element.short: String to replace with

element.name: AnsiMatchStr
element.short: Check whether a string occurs in an array of strings, observing case.

descr.p:
AnsiIndexStr
matches AText against each string in AValues. If a match is found, it returns True, otherwise False is returned. The strings are matched observing case.
This function simply calls ad checks whether it returns -1 or not.

element.name: AnsiMatchStr.Result
element.short:
True
if the value appears in the array, False if not.

element.name: AnsiMatchStr.AText
element.short: String to check for

element.name: AnsiMatchStr.AValues
element.short: Array of string values to search in

element.name: AnsiIndexStr
element.short: Searches, observing case, for a string in an array of strings.
element.descr:
AnsiIndexStr
matches AText
against each string in AValues
. If a match is found, the corresponding index (zero-based) in the AValues
array is returned. If no match is found, -1 is returned.
The strings are matched observing case.

element.name: AnsiIndexStr.Result
element.short: Index of the matching element in the array, otherwise -1.

element.name: AnsiIndexStr.AText
element.short: String to search for

element.name: AnsiIndexStr.AValues
element.short: Array of strings to search in.

element.name: DupeString
element.short: Creates and concatenates N copies of a string

descr.p:
DupeString
returns a string consisting of ACount concatenations of AText. Thus
will produce a string

element.name: DupeString.Result
element.short: Copies of the original string.

element.name: DupeString.AText
element.short: String to duplicate

element.name: DupeString.ACount
element.short: Number of copies to create

element.name: ReverseString
element.short: Reverse characters in a string
element.descr: ReverseString returns a string, made up of the characters in string AText, in reverse order.

element.name: ReverseString.Result
element.short: String with characters in reversed order.

element.name: ReverseString.AText
element.short: String to reverse

element.name: AnsiReverseString
element.short: Reverse the letters in a string.

descr.p:
AnsiReverseString
returns a string with all characters of AText in reverse order.
if the result of this function equals AText, AText is called an anagram.

element.name: AnsiReverseString.Result
element.short: Reversed string

element.name: AnsiReverseString.AText
element.short: String to reverse

element.name: StuffString
element.short: Replace part of a string with another string.
element.descr: StuffString returns a copy of AText with the segment starting at AStart with length ALength, replaced with the string ASubText. Basically it deletes the segment of Atext and inserts the new text in it's place.
element.errors: No checking on the validity of the AStart and ALength parameters is done. Providing invalid values may result in access violation errors.

element.name: StuffString.Result
element.short: Resulting string with indicated section replaced.

element.name: StuffString.AText
element.short: Text on which to operate.

element.name: StuffString.AStart
element.short: Start of section to be replaced.

element.name: StuffString.ALength
element.short: Length of section to be replaced.

element.name: StuffString.ASubText
element.short: Text to insert at the indicated position.

element.name: RandomFrom
element.short: Choose a random string from an array of strings.
element.descr: RandomFrom picks at random a valid index in the array AValues and returns the string at that position in the array.

element.name: RandomFrom.Result
element.short: Random string picked from the array.

element.name: RandomFrom.AValues
element.short: Strings to choose from

element.name: IfThen.AFalse
element.short: String to return if the expression evaluates as false. Default is the empty string.

element.name: IfThen
element.short: Returns one of two strings, depending on a boolean expression
element.descr:
IfThen
returns ATrue if AValue is True, and returns AFalse if AValue is false.

element.name: IfThen.Result
element.short: Either AFalse or ATrue, depending on the expression.

element.name: IfThen.AValue
element.short: Determines which of the two possibilities to take

element.name: IfThen.ATrue
element.short: String to return if the expression evaluates as True.

element.name: RightBStr
element.short: Copy a given number of characters (bytes), counting from the right of a string.
element.descr: RightBStr returns a string containing the rightmost AByteCount bytes from the string AText. If AByteCount is larger than the length (in bytes) of AText, only as many bytes as available are returned.

element.name: RightBStr.Result
element.short: Resulting string.

element.name: RightBStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: RightBStr.AByteCount
element.short: Number of characters (bytes) to copy.

element.name: MidBStr
element.short: Copies a number of characters starting at a given position in a string.
element.descr:
MidBStr
returns a string containing the first AByteCount bytes from the string AText starting at position AByteStart. If AByteStart+AByteCount is larger than the length (in bytes) of AText, only as many bytes as available are returned. If AByteStart is less than 1 or larger than the length of AText, then no characters are returned.

element.name: MidBStr.Result
element.short: Resulting string

element.name: MidBStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: MidBStr.AByteStart
element.short: Position (in bytes) to start copying from.

element.name: MidBStr.AByteCount
element.short: Number of characters (bytes) to copy.

element.name: AnsiLeftStr
element.short: Copies a number of characters starting at the left of a string

descr.p:
AnsiLeftStr
returns the ACount leftmost characters from AText. If ACount is larger than the length of AText, only as much characters as available in AText will be copied. If ACount is zero or negative, no characters will be copied. The characters are counted as characters, not as Bytes.
This function corresponds to the Visual Basic LeftStr function.

element.name: AnsiLeftStr.Result
element.short: Resulting string contains the first ACount characters

element.name: AnsiLeftStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: AnsiLeftStr.ACount
element.short: The number of characters to copy.

element.name: AnsiRightStr
element.short: Copies a number of characters starting at the right of a string

descr.p:
AnsiLeftStr
returns the ACount rightmost characters from AText. If ACount is larger than the length of AText, only as much characters as available in AText will be copied. If ACount is zero or negative, no characters will be copied. The characters are counted as characters, not as Bytes.
This function corresponds to the Visual Basic RightStr function.

element.name: AnsiRightStr.Result
element.short: Resulting string

element.name: AnsiRightStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from

element.name: AnsiRightStr.ACount
element.short: Number of characters to copy

element.name: AnsiMidStr
element.short: Returns a number of characters copied from a given location in a string

descr.p:
AnsiMidStr
returns ACount characters from AText, starting at position AStart. If AStart+ACount is larger than the length of AText, only as much characters as available in AText (starting from AStart) will be copied. If ACount is zero or negative, no characters will be copied. The characters are counted as characters, not as Bytes.
This function corresponds to the Visual Basic MidStr function.

element.name: AnsiMidStr.Result
element.short: The resulting string

element.name: AnsiMidStr.AText
element.short: String from which to copy

element.name: AnsiMidStr.AStart
element.short: 1-based location in the string where to copy from.

element.name: AnsiMidStr.ACount
element.short: Number of characters to copy.

element.name: LeftBStr
element.short: Copies Count characters starting at the left of a string.
element.descr:
LeftBStr
returns a string containing the leftmost AByteCount
bytes from the string AText
. If AByteCount
is larger than the length (in bytes) of AText
, only as many bytes as available are returned.

element.name: LeftBStr.Result
element.short: First N characters of the string.

element.name: LeftBStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: LeftBStr.AByteCount
element.short: Number of characters to copy.

element.name: LeftStr
element.short: Copies Count characters starting at the left of a string.
element.descr:
LeftStr
returns a string containing the leftmost ACount
characters from the string AText
. If ACount
is larger than the length (in characters) of AText
, only as many characters as available are returned.

element.name: LeftStr.Result
element.short: First N characters of the string.

element.name: LeftStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: LeftStr.ACount
element.short: Number of characters to copy.

element.name: RightStr
element.short: Copy a given number of characters, counting from the right of a string.
element.descr:
RightStr
returns a string containing the rightmost ACount characters from the string AText . If ACount is larger than the length (in characters) of AText , only as many characters as available are returned.

element.name: RightStr.Result
element.short: Resulting string.

element.name: RightStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: RightStr.ACount
element.short: Number of characters to copy.

element.name: MidStr
element.short: Copies a number of characters starting at a given position in a string.

descr.p:
MidStr
returns a string containing the first ACount bytes from the string AText starting at position AStart. If AStart+ACount is larger than the length (in characters) of AText, only as many characters as available are returned. If AStart is less than 1 or larger than the length of AText, then no characters are returned.
This function is equivalent to the standard Copy function, and is provided for completeness only.

element.name: MidStr.Result
element.short: Resulting string

element.name: MidStr.AText
element.short: String to copy characters from.

element.name: MidStr.AStart
element.short: Position (in characters) to start copying from.

element.name: MidStr.ACount
element.short: Number of characters to copy.

element.name: WordDelimiters
element.short: Standard word delimiters
element.descr: Standard word delimiters, used in the call.

element.name: TStringSearchOption
element.short: Possible options for call.

element.name: TStringSearchOption.soDown
element.short: Search in down direction.

element.name: TStringSearchOption.soMatchCase
element.short: Match case

element.name: TStringSearchOption.soWholeWord
element.short: Search whole words only.

element.name: TStringSearchOptions
element.short: Set of options for call.

element.name: SearchBuf.Options
element.short: Search options

element.name: SearchBuf
element.short: Search a buffer for a certain string.

descr.p:
SearchBuf
searches the buffer Buf for the occurrence of SearchString. At must Buflen characters are searched, and the search is started at SelStart+SelLength. If a match is found, a pointer to the position of the match is returned. The parameter Options specifies how the search is conducted. It is a set of the following options:

tr.td: Searches forward, starting at the end of the selection. Default is searching up
Observe case when searching. Default is to ignore case.
Match only whole words. Default also returns parts of words

descr.p: The standard constant is used to mark the boundaries of words.
The SelStart parameter is zero based.

element.errors: Buflen must be the real length of the string, no checking on this is performed.

element.name: SearchBuf.Result
element.short: Position of the string

element.name: SearchBuf.Buf
element.short: Buffer to search

element.name: SearchBuf.BufLen
element.short: Length of the buffer.

element.name: SearchBuf.SelStart
element.short: Start of selection.

element.name: SearchBuf.SelLength
element.short: Length of selection.

element.name: SearchBuf.SearchString
element.short: String to search for.

element.name: PosEx.SubStr
element.short: String to search for.

element.name: PosEx
element.short: Search for the occurance of a character in a string, starting at a certain position.
element.descr: PosEx returns the position of the first occurrence of the character C or the substring SubStr in the string S, starting the search at position Offset (default 1). If C or SubStr does not occur in S after the given Offset, zero is returned. The position Offset is also searched.

element.name: PosEx.Result
element.short: Position of the character, or -1 if it is not found.

element.name: PosEx.c
element.short: Character to search for.

element.name: PosEx.S
element.short: String to search.

element.name: PosEx.Offset
element.short: Initial position where to start searching.

element.name: TSoundexLength
element.short: Range of allowed soundex lengths.

element.name: Soundex.ALength
element.short: Length of the soundex

element.name: Soundex
element.short: Compute the soundex of a string
element.descr: Soundex computes a soundex code for AText. The resulting code will at most have ALength characters. The soundex code is computed according to the US system of soundex computing, which may result in inaccurate results in other languages.

element.name: Soundex.Result
element.short: String with the soundex code of the original string.

element.name: Soundex.AText
element.short: Text to compute soundex of

element.name: TSoundexIntLength
element.short: Range of allowed integer soundex lengths.

element.name: SoundexInt.ALength
element.short: Length of the soundex value to compute.

element.name: SoundexInt
element.short: Soundex value as an integer.
element.descr: SoundexInt computes the code (with length ALength, default 4) of AText, and converts the code to an integer value.

element.name: SoundexInt.Result
element.short: Soundex value as a astring.

element.name: SoundexInt.AText
element.short: Text for which to compute soundex value.

element.name: DecodeSoundexInt
element.short: Decodes the integer representation of a soundex code and returns the original soundex code.
element.descr:
DecodeSoundexInt
converts the integer value AValue to a soundex string. It performs the reverse operation of the function. The result is the soundex string corresponding to AValue.
.

element.name: DecodeSoundexInt.Result
element.short: Soundex code corresponding to the integer value.

element.name: DecodeSoundexInt.AValue
element.short: Integer soundex value.

element.name: SoundexWord
element.short: Calculate a word-sized soundex value
element.descr: SoundexInt computes the code (with length 4) of AText , and converts the code to a word-sized value.

element.name: SoundexWord.Result
element.short: Soundex value as a word.

element.name: SoundexWord.AText
element.short: String to calculate soundex value of

element.name: DecodeSoundexWord
element.short: Decodes the word-sized representation of a soundex code and returns the original soundex code.
element.descr:
DecodeSoundexWord
converts the integer value AValue to a soundex string. It performs the reverse operation of the function. The result is the soundex string corresponding to AValue .

element.name: DecodeSoundexWord.Result
element.short: Soundex code corresponding to the word-sized value.

element.name: DecodeSoundexWord.AValue
element.short: Word-sized soundex value.

element.name: SoundexSimilar.ALength
element.short: Soundex length (default 4)

element.name: SoundexSimilar
element.short: Check whether 2 strings have equal soundex values
element.descr: SoundexSimilar returns True if the soundex codes (with length ALength) of AText and AOther are equal, and False if they are not.

element.name: SoundexSimilar.Result
element.short:
True
if the strings have the same soundex value, False otherwise

element.name: SoundexSimilar.AText
element.short: First string

element.name: SoundexSimilar.AOther
element.short: Second string

element.name: SoundexCompare.ALength
element.short: Length of soundexes to compare.

element.name: SoundexCompare
element.short: Compare soundex values of 2 strings.
element.descr: SoundexCompare computes the soundex codes of AText and AOther and feeds these to CompareText. It will return -1 if the soundex code of AText is less than the soundex code of AOther, 0 if they are equal, and 1 if the code of AOther is larger than the code of AText.

element.name: SoundexCompare.Result
element.short: 0 if the soundexes are equal. Negative of the first is smaller as the second, positive otherwise.

element.name: SoundexCompare.AText
element.short: First string.

element.name: SoundexCompare.AOther
element.short: Second string.

element.name: SoundexProc
element.short: Default AnsiResemblesText implementation.
element.descr: SoundexProc is the standard implementation for the procedure: By default, AnsiResemblesProc is set to this function. It compares the soundex codes of AOther and AText and returns True if they are equal, or False if they are not.

element.name: SoundexProc.Result
element.short: 0 if the soundexes are equal. Negative of the first is smaller as the second, positive otherwise.

element.name: SoundexProc.AText
element.short: Second string.

element.name: SoundexProc.AOther
element.short: First string.

element.name: TCompareTextProc
element.short: Function prototype for comparing two string in

element.name: TCompareTextProc.Result
element.short: True if strings match, false otherwise.

element.name: TCompareTextProc.AText
element.short: First string

element.name: TCompareTextProc.AOther
element.short: Second string.

element.name: AnsiResemblesProc
element.short: Procedural variable, called when checking 2 strings for resemblances in
element.descr: This procedural variable is standard set to but can be overriden with a user-defined algorithm. This algorithm should return True if AText resembles AOtherText, or False otherwise. The standard routine compares the soundexes of the two strings and returns True if they are equal.

element.name: IsEmptyStr
element.short: Check whether a string is empty, disregaring whitespace characters
element.descr:
IsEmptyStr
returns True if the string S only contains characters whitespace characters, all characters in EmptyChars are considered whitespace characters. If a character not present in EmptyChars is found in S, False is returned.

element.name: IsEmptyStr.Result
element.short:
True
if the string consists solely of empty characters.

element.name: IsEmptyStr.S
element.short: String to check

element.name: IsEmptyStr.EmptyChars
element.short: Characters to consider as whitespace

element.name: DelSpace
element.short: Delete all occurrences of a space from a string.
element.descr:
DelSpace
returns a copy of S
with all spaces (ASCII code 32) removed from it.

element.name: DelSpace.Result
element.short: String with all spaces removed.

element.name: DelSpace.S
element.short: String to delete spaces from.

element.name: DelChars
element.short: Delete all occurrences of a given character from a string.
element.descr:
DelChars
returns a copy of S with all Chr characters removed from it.

element.name: DelChars.Result
element.short: Original string with all occurrences of the given character deleted.

element.name: DelChars.S
element.short: String to delete characters from.

element.name: DelChars.Chr
element.short: Character which must be deleted.

element.name: DelSpace1
element.short: Reduces sequences of space characters to 1 space character.
element.descr:
DelSpace1
returns a copy of S with all sequences of spaces reduced to 1 space.

element.name: DelSpace1.Result
element.short: Original string with series of maximal 1 space.

element.name: DelSpace1.S
element.short: String to reduce space sequences in.

element.name: Tab2Space
element.short: Convert tab characters to a number of spaces
element.descr: Tab2Space returns a copy of S with all tab characters (ASCII character 9) converted to Numb spaces.

element.name: Tab2Space.Result
element.short: Strng with tab characters replaced

element.name: Tab2Space.S
element.short: String in which to replace tab characters.

element.name: Tab2Space.Numb
element.short: Number of spaces to replace tab characters with.

element.name: NPos
element.short: Returns the position of the N-th occurence of a substring in a string.
element.descr:
NPos
checks S for the position of the N-th occurrence of C. If C occurs less than N times in S, or does not occur in S at all, 0 is returned. If N is less than 1, zero is returned.

element.name: NPos.Result
element.short: Position of N-th occurrence of the substring, -1 if there is none.

element.name: NPos.C
element.short: Substring to search for

element.name: NPos.S
element.short: String to search.

element.name: NPos.N
element.short: Which position to return

element.name: AddChar
element.short: Add characters to the left of a string till a certain length
element.descr:
AddChar
adds characters (C
) to the left of S till the length N
is reached, and returns the resulting string. If the length of S
is already equal to or larger than N
, then no characters are added. The resulting string can be thought of as a right-aligned version of S
, with length N
.

element.name: AddChar.Result
element.short: The resulting string with length N

element.name: AddChar.C
element.short: Char to be added

element.name: AddChar.S
element.short: The string to be treated

element.name: AddChar.N
element.short: The minimal length the string should have

element.name: AddCharR
element.short: Add chars at the end of a string till it reaches a certain length
element.descr:
AddCharR
adds characters (C) to the right of S till the length N is reached, and returns the resulting string. If the length of S is already equal to or larger than N, then no characters are added. The resulting string can be thought of as a left-aligned version of S, with length N .

element.name: AddCharR.Result
element.short: The resulting string with length N

element.name: AddCharR.C
element.short: The character to be added

element.name: AddCharR.S
element.short: The string to be treated

element.name: AddCharR.N
element.short: The minimal length the string should have

element.name: PadLeft
element.short: Add spaces to the left of a string till a certain length is reached.
element.descr:
PadLeft
add spaces to the left of the string S
till the result reaches length Len
. If the string S
has length equal to or largert than Len
, no spaces are added, and the string S
is returned as-is. The resulting string is S
, right-justified on length Len
.

element.name: PadLeft.Result
element.short: String of length N, padded to the left with spaces

element.name: PadLeft.S
element.short: String to pad.

element.name: PadLeft.N
element.short: Minimal length of the resulting string.

element.name: PadRight
element.short: Add spaces to the right of a string till a certain length is reached.
element.descr:
PadRight add spaces to the left of the string S till the result reaches length Len. If the string S has length equal to or largert than Len, no spaces are added, and the string S is returned as-is. The resulting string is S, left-justified on length Len
.

element.name: PadRight.Result
element.short: String of length N, padded to the right with spaces

element.name: PadRight.S
element.short: String to pad.

element.name: PadRight.N
element.short: Minimal length of the resulting string.

element.name: PadCenter
element.short: Pad the string to a certain length, so the string is centered.
element.descr: PadCenter add spaces to the left and right of the string S till the result reaches length Len. If the number of spaces to add is odd, then the extra space will be added at the end. If the string S has length equal to or largert than Len, no spaces are added, and the string S is returned as-is.

element.name: PadCenter.Result
element.short: Centered string of the specified length

element.name: PadCenter.S
element.short: String to center

element.name: PadCenter.Len
element.short: Desired length of the resulting string

element.name: Copy2Symb
element.short: Returns all characters in a string till a given character (not included).

descr.p:
Copy2SymbDel
determines the position of the first occurrence of Symb in the string S and returns all characters up to this position. The Symb character itself is not included in the result string. The string S is left untouched. If Symb does not appear in S, then the whole of S is returned.

element.name: Copy2Symb.Result
element.short: Characters from the string till the first occurence of the given character.

element.name: Copy2Symb.S
element.short: String to return first characters from.

element.name: Copy2Symb.Symb
element.short: Symbol till which characters will be copied. Will not be included in the result.

element.name: Copy2SymbDel
element.short: Deletes and returns all characters in a string till a given character (not included).

descr.p:
Copy2SymbDel
determines the position of the first occurrence of Symb in the string S and returns all characters up to this position. The Symb character itself is not included in the result string. All returned characters, including the Symb character, are deleted from the string S, after which it is right-trimmed. If Symb does not appear in S, then the whole of S is returned, and S itself is emptied.

element.name: Copy2SymbDel.Result
element.short: Characters from the string till the first occurence of the given character.

element.name: Copy2SymbDel.S
element.short: String to delete and return first characters from.

element.name: Copy2SymbDel.Symb
element.short: Symbol till which characters will be copied. Will not be included in the result.

element.name: Copy2Space
element.short: Returns all characters in a string till the first space character (not included).

descr.p:
Copy2Space
determines the position of the first space in the string S and returns all characters up to this position. The space character itself is not included in the result string. The string S is left untouched. If there is no space in S, then the whole string S is returned.
This function simply calls with the space (ASCII code 32) as the symbol argument.

element.name: Copy2Space.Result
element.short: Characters from S till the first space.

element.name: Copy2Space.S
element.short: String to return first characters from.

element.name: Copy2SpaceDel
element.short: Deletes and returns all characters in a string till the first space character (not included).

descr.p:
Copy2SpaceDel
determines the position of the first space in the string S and returns all characters up to this position. The space character itself is not included in the result string. All returned characters, including the space, are deleted from the string S, after which it is right-trimmed. If there is no space in S, then the whole string S is returned, and S itself is emptied.
This function simply calls with the space (ASCII code 32) as the symbol argument.

element.name: Copy2SpaceDel.Result
element.short: Deleted characters from the string

element.name: Copy2SpaceDel.S
element.short: String to delete and return first characters from.

element.name: AnsiProperCase
element.short: Pretty-Print a string: make lowercase and capitalize first letters of words
element.descr:
AnsiProperCase
converts S to an all lowercase string, but capitalizes the first letter of every word in the string, and returns the resulting string. When searching for words, the characters in WordDelimiters are used to determine the boundaries of words. The constant can be used for this.

element.name: AnsiProperCase.Result
element.short: Resulting lowercase string with first letters capitalized

element.name: AnsiProperCase.S
element.short: String to pretty-print

element.name: AnsiProperCase.WordDelims
element.short: Characters to use as word delimiters

element.name: WordCount
element.short: Count the number of words in a string.

descr.p: WordCount returns the number of words in the string S. A word is a non-empty string of characters bounded by one of the characters in WordDelims.
The pre-defined constant can be used for the WordDelims argument.

element.name: WordCount.Result
element.short: Number of words in the string.

element.name: WordCount.S
element.short: String to search in.

element.name: WordCount.WordDelims
element.short: Characters to be used as word delimiters.

element.name: WordPosition
element.short: Search position of Nth word in a string.

descr.p: WordPosition returns the position (in characters) of the N-th word in the string S. A word is a non-empty string of characters bounded by one of the characters in WordDelims. If N is out of range, zero is returned.
The pre-defined constant can be used for the WordDelims argument.

element.name: WordPosition.Result
element.short: Position of the N-th word, or -1 if there is none.

element.name: WordPosition.N
element.short: Which word to search for

element.name: WordPosition.S
element.short: String to search in.

element.name: WordPosition.WordDelims
element.short: Characters to be used as word delimiters.

element.name: ExtractWord
element.short: Extract the N-th word out of a string.

descr.p:
ExtractWord
extracts the N-th word from the string S. The set of characters in WordDelims are used to mark word boundaries. A word is defined as any non-empty sequence of characters which are not present in WordDelims: if a character is not in WordDelims, it is considered as part of a word. If an N-th word cannot be found, an empty string is returned.
Unlike , an empty string is not a valid return value, i.e. is not a word. If an empty string is returned, the index N was out of range.
The pre-defined constant can be used for the WordDelims argument.

element.name: ExtractWord.Result
element.short: The N-th word, or empty if N is out of range.

element.name: ExtractWord.N
element.short: Which word to extract.

element.name: ExtractWord.S
element.short: String to extract the word from.

element.name: ExtractWord.WordDelims
element.short: Characters to use as word delimiters

element.name: ExtractWordPos
element.short: Extract a word from a string, and return the position where it was located in the string.

descr.p:
ExtractWordPos
extracts the N-th word from the string S and returns the position of this word in Pos. The set of characters in WordDelims are used to mark word boundaries. A word is defined as any non-empty sequence of characters which are not present in WordDelims : if a character is not in WordDelims , it is considered as part of a word. If an N -th word cannot be found, an empty string is returned and Pos is zero.
Unlike , an empty string is not a valid return value, i.e. is not a word. If an empty string is returned, the index N was out of range.
The pre-defined constant can be used for the WordDelims argument.

element.name: ExtractWordPos.Result
element.short: N-th word of the string, or empty if N is out of range.

element.name: ExtractWordPos.N
element.short: Which word to extract

element.name: ExtractWordPos.S
element.short: String to extract a word from.

element.name: ExtractWordPos.WordDelims
element.short: Characters to use as word delimiters

element.name: ExtractWordPos.Pos
element.short: On return, contains the position of the N-th word.

element.name: ExtractDelimited
element.short: Extract the N-th delimited part from a string.

descr.p:
ExtractDelimited
extracts the N-th part from the string S. The set of characters in Delims are used to mark part boundaries. When a delimiter is encountered, a new part is started and the old part is ended. Another way of stating this is that any (possibly empty) series of characters not in Delims, situated between 2 characters in Delims, it is considered as piece of a part. This means that if 2 delimiter characters appear next to each other, there is an empty part between it. If an N-th part cannot be found, an empty string is returned. However, unlike , an empty string is a valid return value, i.e. a part can be empty.
The pre-defined constant can be used for the Delims argument. The pre-defined constant would be better suited the Delims argument e.g. in case factors in a mathematical expression are searched.

element.name: ExtractDelimited.Result
element.short: N-th word

element.name: ExtractDelimited.N
element.short: Which word to extract

element.name: ExtractDelimited.S
element.short: String to extract word from

element.name: ExtractDelimited.Delims
element.short: Characters to use as word delimiters.

element.name: ExtractSubstr
element.short: Extract a word from a string, starting at a given position in the string.

descr.p:
ExtractSubStr
returns all characters from S starting at position Pos till the first character in Delims, or till the end of S is reached. The delimiter character is not included in the result. Pos is then updated to point to the next first non-delimiter character in S. If Pos is larger than the Length of S, an empty string is returned.
The pre-defined constant can be used for the Delims argument.

element.name: ExtractSubstr.Result
element.short: The extracted word.

element.name: ExtractSubstr.S
element.short: String to search in.

element.name: ExtractSubstr.Pos
element.short: Initial position to start extracting. On exit returns the position of the next word.

element.name: ExtractSubstr.Delims
element.short: Characters to use as word delimiters

element.name: IsWordPresent
element.short: Check for the presence of a word in a string.

descr.p:
IsWordPresent
checks for the presence of the word W in the string S. Words are delimited by the characters found in WordDelims. The function returns True if a match is found, False otherwise. The search is performed case sensitive.
This function is equivalent to the function with the soWholeWords option specified.

element.name: IsWordPresent.Result
element.short:
True
if the word is present, False if not.

element.name: IsWordPresent.W
element.short: Word to search for

element.name: IsWordPresent.S
element.short: String to search

element.name: IsWordPresent.WordDelims
element.short: Characters to use as word separators

element.name: FindPart
element.short: Search for a substring in a string, using wildcards.
element.descr:
FindPart
searches the string InputStr and returns the first string that matches the wildcards specification in HelpWilds . If no match is found, and empty string is returned. valid wildcards are the "?" (question mark) and "*" (asterisk) characters.

element.name: FindPart.Result
element.short: String matching the search expression.

element.name: FindPart.HelpWilds
element.short: Search string, may contain wildcards.

element.name: FindPart.InputStr
element.short: String to search in.

element.name: IsWild
element.short: Check whether a string matches a wildcard search expression.

descr.p:
IsWild
checks InputStr for the presence of the Wilds string. Wilds may contain "?" and "*" wildcard characters, which have their usual meaning: "*" matches any series of characters, possibly empty. "?" matches any single character. The function returns True if a string is found that matches Wilds, False otherwise.
If IgnoreCase is True, the non-wildcard characters are matched case insensitively. If it is False, case is observed when searching.

element.name: IsWild.Result
element.short:
True
if the string matches the wildcard specification, False otherwise.

element.name: IsWild.InputStr
element.short: String to search

element.name: IsWild.Wilds
element.short: Wildcard specification

element.name: IsWild.IgnoreCase
element.short: Search case insensitive or not.

element.name: XorString
element.short: Encode a string by XOR-ing its characters using characters of a given key.

descr.p: XorString encodes the string Src by XOR-ing each character in Source with the corresponding character in Key, repeating Key as often as necessary. The resulting string may contain unreadable characters and may even contain null characters. For this reason it may be a better idea to use the function instead, which will representing each resulting ASCII code as a hexadecimal number (of length 2).
Feeding the result again to XorString with the same Key, will result in the original string Src.

element.name: XorString.Result
element.short: Resulting string

element.name: XorString.Key
element.short: Key to use

element.name: XorString.Src
element.short: String to encode.

element.name: XorEncode
element.short: Encode a string by XOR-ing its characters using characters of a given key, representing the result as hex values.

descr.p: XorEncode encodes the string Source by XOR-ing each character in Source with the corresponding character in Key (repeating Key as often as necessary) and representing the resulting ASCII code as a hexadecimal number (of length 2). The result is therefore twice as long as the original string, and every 2 bytes represent an ASCII code.
Feeding the resulting string with the same key Key to the function will result in the original Source string.
This function can be used e.g. to trivially encode a password in a configuration file.

element.name: XorEncode.Result
element.short: Original encoded string.

element.name: XorEncode.Key
element.short: Key to use when encoding.

element.name: XorEncode.Source
element.short: String ro encode.

element.name: XorDecode
element.short: Decode a string encoded with
element.descr: XorDecode decodes Source and returns the original string that was encrypted using with key Key. If a different key is used than the key used to encode the string, the result will be unreadable.
element.errors: If the string Source is not a valid XorEncode result (e.g. contains non-numerical characters), then a EConversionError exception will be raised.

element.name: XorDecode.Result
element.short: Hexadecimal representation of the XOR-encoded string.

element.name: XorDecode.Key
element.short: Key to use when decoding.

element.name: XorDecode.Source
element.short: String to decode

element.name: GetCmdLineArg
element.short: Returns the command-line argument following the given switch.

descr.p:
GetCmdLineArg
returns the value for the Switch option on the command-line, if any is given. Command-line arguments are considered switches if they start with one of the characters in the SwitchChars set. The value is the command-line argument following the switch command-line argument.
Gnu-style (long) Options of the form switch=value are not supported.
The constant can be used as value for the SwitchChars parameter.

errors.p: The GetCmdLineArg does not check whether the value of the option does not start with a switch character. i.e.
will result in "-option2" as the result of the GetCmdLineArg call for option1.

element.name: GetCmdLineArg.Result
element.short: Command line argument that followed the switch

element.name: GetCmdLineArg.Switch
element.short: Switch to search for

element.name: GetCmdLineArg.SwitchChars
element.short: Switch characters to use. Can be empty.

element.name: Numb2USA
element.short: Insert thousand separators.
element.descr: Numb2USA inserts thousand separators in the string S at the places where they are supposed to be, i.e. every 3 digits. The string S should contain a valid integer number, i.e. no digital number. No checking on this is done.

element.name: Numb2USA.Result
element.short: String with thousand separators inserted.

element.name: Numb2USA.S
element.short: String to insert thousand separators in.

element.name: Hex2Dec
element.short: Converts a hexadecimal string to a decimal value
element.descr:
Hex2Dec
converts the hexadecimal value in the string S to its decimal value. Unlike the standard Valor StrToInt functions, there need not be a $ sign in front of the hexadecimal value to indicate that it is indeed a hexadecimal value.
element.errors: If S does not contain a valid hexadecimal value, an EConvertError exception will be raised.

element.name: Hex2Dec.Result
element.short: Hexadecimal value of the string

element.name: Hex2Dec.S
element.short: String to convert

element.name: Dec2Numb
element.short: Convert a decimal number to a string representation, using given a base.
element.descr:
Dec2Numb
converts N to its representation using base Base . The resulting string is left-padded with zeroes till it has length Len . Base must be in the range 2-36 to be meaningful, but no checking on this is performed.
element.errors: If Base is out of range, the resulting string will contain unreadable (non-alphanumeric) characters.

element.name: Dec2Numb.Result
element.short: The representation of the given number.

element.name: Dec2Numb.N
element.short: Number to represent.

element.name: Dec2Numb.Len
element.short: Minimal length of the returned string

element.name: Dec2Numb.Base
element.short: Base to use when converting

element.name: Numb2Dec
element.short: Converts a string representation of a number to its numerical value, given a certain base.
element.descr: Numb2Dec converts the number in string S to a decimal value. It assumes the number is represented using Base as the base. No checking is performed to see whether S contains a valid number using base Base.

element.name: Numb2Dec.Result
element.short: Numerical value of the string.

element.name: Numb2Dec.S
element.short: String to convert

element.name: Numb2Dec.Base
element.short: Base to use when converting.

element.name: IntToBin
element.short: Converts an integer to a binary string representation, inserting spaces at fixed locations.
element.descr:
IntToBin
converts Value to a string with it's binary (base 2) representation. The resulting string contains at least Digits digits, with spaces inserted every Spaces digits. Spaces should be a nonzero value. If Digits is larger than 32, it is truncated to 32.
element.errors: If spaces is zero, a division by zero error will occur.

element.name: IntToBin.Result
element.short: Resulting string

element.name: IntToBin.Value
element.short: Value to convert

element.name: IntToBin.Digits
element.short: Number of bits in the resulting string.

element.name: IntToBin.Spaces
element.short: Number of digits after which to insert a space.

element.name: IntToRoman
element.short: Represent an integer with roman numerals
element.descr:
IntToRoman
converts Value to a string with the Roman representation of Value. Number up to 1 million can be represented this way.

element.name: IntToRoman.Result
element.short:
Value
in roman numerals

element.name: IntToRoman.Value
element.short: Value to convert

element.name: RomanToInt
element.short: Convert a string with a Roman number to it's decimal value.
element.descr: RomanToInt returns the decimal equivalent of the Roman numerals in the string S. Invalid characters are dropped from S. A negative numeral is supported as well.

element.name: RomanToInt.Result
element.short: Value of the string.

element.name: RomanToInt.S
element.short: String to convert.

element.name: DigitChars
element.short: Set of digit characters

element.name: Brackets
element.short: Set of characters that contain all possible bracket characters

element.name: StdWordDelims
element.short: Standard word delimiter values.

element.name: TStringSeachOption
element.short: Possible options for call.
element.descr: There is an typo error in the original Borland StrUtils unit. This type just refers to the correct and is provided for compatibility only.

element.name: StdSwitchChars
element.short: Standard characters for the SwitchChars argument of .

element.name: BinToHex
element.short: Convert a binary buffer to a hexadecimal string

descr.p: BinToHex converts the byte values in BinValue to a string consisting of 2-charachter hexadecimal strings in HexValue. BufSize specifies the length of BinValue, which means that HexValue must have size 2*BufSize.
For example a buffer containing the byte values 255 and 0 will be converted to FF00.

element.errors: No length checking is done, so if an invalid size is specified, an exception may follow.

element.name: HexToBin
element.short: Convert a hexadecimal string to a binary buffer
element.descr: HexToBin scans the hexadecimal string representation in HexValue and transforms every 2 character hexadecimal number to a byte and stores it in BinValue. The buffer size is the size of the binary buffer. Scanning will stop if the size of the binary buffer is reached or when an invalid character is encountered. The return value is the number of stored bytes.
element.errors: No length checking is done, so if an invalid size is specified, an exception may follow.

element.name: RPos
element.short: Find last occurrence of substring or character in a string
element.descr: RPos looks in S for the character C or the string SubStr. It starts looking at the end of the string, and searches towards the beginning of the string. If a match is found, it returns the position of the match.

element.name: RPosex
element.short: Find last occurrence substring or character in a string, starting at a certain position
element.descr: RPos looks in S for the character C or the string SubStr. It starts looking at position Offs, and searches towards the beginning of the string. If a match is found, it returns the position of the match.
